Threat Hunting Using MITRE ATT&CK

Project Title Threat Hunting Using MITRE ATT&CK
Category Threat Hunting
Environment Corporate Enterprise
Tools Used SIEM, EDR Telemetry
Framework MITRE ATT&CK

What I did

Conducted proactive, hypothesis-driven threat hunting across SIEM data to identify stealthy threats that bypassed automated security controls.

Execution Steps

  • Selected high-risk ATT&CK techniques based on the current threat landscape (e.g., Credential Access, Lateral Movement).
  • Formulated hunting hypotheses based on specific behaviors and environmental blind spots.
  • Developed and executed complex queries across SIEM raw logs to identify anomalies.
  • Validated potential findings using secondary telemetry from EDR platforms and email gateways.
  • Documented confirmed findings and provided actionable remediation recommendations.
→ Outcome & Impact
  • Identified previously undetected suspicious activities and policy violations.
  • Significantly improved the organization's proactive detection capability.
  • Hardened security posture by closing identified gaps.
